Pre-Game Insights: England host Greece in their third UEFA Nations League match, hoping to maintain their 100% winning record.
England won their opening two UEFA Nations League B2 games under new interim manager Lee Carsley, defeating Ireland and Finland 2-0.
Harry Kane scored both goals against Finland on the night he won his 100th cap.
Greece also started a new managerial era with Ivan Jovanovic, taking six points from Finland and Ireland in the first round of games.
England are huge favourites to take maximum points, priced at around 3/10 (1.30).
The match will be played at Wembley Stadium in London, England, and can be watched live on ITV and STV.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England have never lost to Greece in nine previous meetings, winning seven of them.
This will be the first match between England and Greece in 18 years.
